page.title: 12LOCAL HISTORY - MUSEUM
page.content: Dartford has been lived in for many years and it has an interesting history which you can find out about by visiting the local museum. It has an old Roman stone coffin which was found on East Hill and the original skeleton was of a rich Roman lady. The skeleton now in the coffin is an assortment of male and female bones. The museum also has a model of the Holy Trinity Norman Church and the architect who designed it also designed part of the Tower of London and Rochester Castle. It also has two stuffed Dartford Warblers, birds now only found in Hampshire and the Channel Is. There are also a stuffed fox and cat. There is a very old glass bowl which was found when they dug the foundations of Darenth Park hospital. It is called the Darent Bowl and it is a very unique item.
